Define custom paths for a page
Define multiple aliases for a single page
Define multiple params regardless of pages directory structure
锔 If you are using Nuxt
Simple aliases will be added as router alias, see
Simply add a block inside Vue file and define a path in JavaScript or
Define multiple aliases for single page
If you want more paths for a single page, define them with aliases
Aliases can have their own props

<router>
  path: /posts
  alias:
      - /articles
      - 
        path: /blog
        props:
          section: top-posts
</router>
Define named views for the page

<router>
{
  namedViews: {
    currentView: 'main',
    views: {
      side: '~/components/side.vue'
    },
    chunkNames: {
      side: 'components/side'
    }
  }
}
</router>

<router>
  namedViews:
    currentView: "main"
    views:
      side: "~/components/side.vue"
    chunkNames:
      side: "~/components/side.vue"
</router>
Add single or multiple aliases to page, Module supports two types of aliases
: These aliases are defined as simple strings. If
is true, simple aliases will be added as router alias, see vue-router

: These aliases are in form of object and they can have their own extras. These aliases will be added as an individual route. They can have their own props and they can have different number of url params
Add Meta information to the page, meta can be used by middlewares
Use case sensitive route match (default: false)
Redirect current page to new location
Add named view to the path, see
, but it requires the user to write a lot of boilerplate code in the config. The
block allows for a more streamlined configuration
Named views key is a bit different from all other settings. It expects an object with following properties:
: actual view name for the current component. Defaults to
: object, where keys are view names and values are component paths. It supports all expected path resolution (
: object, where keys are view names and values are webpack chunks for them. Object structure is expected to be equal to
- all the same keys must be present.
